column1: No true Christian would ever endorse same-sex marriage.
No true feminist would ever stay home and raise children.
A real vegan would never even think of consuming honey.
No true scientist would ever believe in creationism.
Real men don't cry or express emotions.
No authentic Italian would ever cook pasta al dente.
No true patriot would ever protest against their own country.
A real businessman never discloses his profit margins.
No genuine artist would ever sell their work for monetary gain.
No true athlete would ever swear off all forms of workout during their off season.
No true environmentalist would drive a gas-guzzling vehicle.
A real musician wouldn't consider synthesized music as real music.
No true nationalist would ever denounce their country's history.
No genuine egalitarian would argue that some people are naturally superior.
No true philanthropist would ever donate just for tax benefits.
No real book lover would ever enjoy reading e-books.
No true tech enthusiast would ever own outdated devices.
No real animal lover would eat meat.
No true environmentalist would use single-use plastic.
No true horror fan would admit getting scared while watching a horror movie.
Frank claims to be a loyal supporter of the team
column2: but I saw him cheering when the opposing team scored. Clearly
column3: no true supporter would be happy when their team is losing. Therefore
column4: Frank is not a true supporter.

column1: Liam claims to love rock music
column2: but dislikes Aerosmith. Any true rock music fan loves Aerosmith. Hence
column3: he is not a true rock music fan.

column1: Diana claims to be a dedicated teacher
column2: but she shows movies in class sometimes. No true teacher would ever resort to just showing movies. Therefore
column3: Diana is not a true teacher.

column1: Laura claims to be a feminist
column2: however she chooses to be a stay-at-home mom. Any true feminist would never choose to stay at home. Therefore
column3: Laura is not a real feminist.

column1: Mike professes to be a foodie
column2: yet he shies away from trying exotic international cuisines. Any true foodie would relish all sorts of cuisines. Hence
column3: Mike is not a true foodie.

column1: Brian says he is a tech enthusiast
column2: yet he doesn't own any latest models of smartphones or computers. A true tech enthusiast would always maintain up-to-date tech appliances
column3: thus Brian is not a true tech enthusiast.

column1: Jade proclaims she is a book lover
column2: yet she reads mostly on her Kindle. Any true book lover would insist on reading only physical books. Hence
column3: Jade is not a true book lover.

column3: Martin is not a true sci-fi fan.

column1: Ana portrays herself as an environmental activist but uses plastic grocery bags. No true environmental activist would use single-use plastics

column2: Emily is not an authentic animal lover.

column2: but she has never been to Africa. Any true traveler would have Africa on their map. So

Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge. Andy thus changes the terms of the argument
column2: implying that Dougal is not a true Scotsman in order to support his own position.

column1: Angus declares that Scotsmen do not put sugar on their porridge
column2: to which Lachlan points out that he is a Scotsman and puts sugar on his porridge. Furious
column3: like a true Scot
column4: Angus yells that no true Scotsman sugars his porridge.

column2: Christian broadcaster
column3: Harold Camping
column4: (once again) predicted the end of the world via Jesus
column5: and managed to get many Christians to join his alarmist campaign.  During this time
column6: and especially after the Armageddon date had passed
column7: many Christian groups publicly declared that Camping is not a “true Christian”.  On a personal note
column8: I think Camping was and is as much of a Christian as any other self-proclaimed Christian and religious/political/ethical beliefs aside
column9: I give him credit for having the cojones to make a falsifiable claim about his religious beliefs.Example #2:

column1: John: Members of the UbaTuba White Men's Club are upstanding citizens of the community. Marvin: Then why are there so many of these members in jail? John: They were never true UbaTuba White Men's Club members. Marvin: What’s a true UbaTuba White Men's Club member? John: Those who don't go to jail.
column2: This is a very common form of this fallacy that has many variations.  Every time one group member denounces another group member for doing or saying something that they don’t approve of
column3: usually by the phrase
column4: “he is not really a true [insert membership here]”
column5: this fallacy is committed. The universal claim here is that no UbaTuba White Men's Club member will ever (universal) go to jail.  Marvin points out how clearly this is counterfactual as there are many UbaTuba White Men's Club members in jail.  Instead of conceding or meaningfully revising the claim
column6: the implication that no UbaTuba White Men's Club members is changed to “no true UbaTuba White Men's Club members”
column7: which is not meaningful because John’s definition of a “true UbaTuba White Men's Club member” apparently can only be demonstrated in the negative if an UbaTuba White Men's Club member goes to jail.  This results in the questionable cause fallacy as it is also an unfalsifiable claim
column9: it commits the no true Scotsman fallacy.

column1: The ideas from that member of the club are wrong
column2: but he isn’t actually a true member of the club so his ideas do not matter.
column3: This is a “purity test” where you rebut an argument by saying that the offender really wasn’t a member of your group.

column1: Person 1: If you are a Marvel fan then you love Avengers: Endgame. Person 2: I am a Marvel fan and I did not love Avengers: Endgame. Person 1: Well you aren’t a TRUE Marvel fan.”
column2: This is a “purity test” where you rebut an argument by saying that the offender really wasn’t a member of your group.
